ptolemy.homer.kernel

Class MultiContent<T extends ContentPrototype>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptolemy.homer.kernel.MultiContent<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The class implementing a ContentPrototype. It represents a tab that can create one similar to itself using the prototype pattern.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HomerMultiContent

    public class MultiContent<T extends ContentPrototype>
extends java.lang.Object
    Store a model's element representations on multiple contents.
    Since:
    Ptolemy II 10.0
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Peter Foldes
    Accepted Rating:
    Red (pdf)
    Proposed Rating:
    Red (pdf)

      Constructor and Description
      MultiContent(T contentPrototype)
      Create a new multi-content frame based on a content prototype.
      MultiContent(T contentPrototype, CompositeEntity model)
      The constructor takes a model that is parsed for elements with location attributes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiContent

        public MultiContent(T contentPrototype)
        Create a new multi-content frame based on a content prototype.
        Parameters:
        contentPrototype - A prototype of the content area. This prototype is used to create multiple content areas on demand.

      • MultiContent

        public MultiContent(T contentPrototype,
                    CompositeEntity model)
             throws IllegalActionException,
                    NameDuplicationException
        The constructor takes a model that is parsed for elements with location attributes. All that should be represented are parsed and placed in multiple content areas depending on their parameters.
        Parameters:
        model - The model to be parsed.
        contentPrototype - A prototype of the content area. This prototype is used to create multiple content areas on demand.
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException - If any of the elements can't be places into a content area.
        NameDuplicationException - If multiple elements exist with the same name. Element names within a workspace must be unique.

    • Method Detail

      • addTab

        public java.lang.String addTab(ComponentEntity topLevel,
                               java.lang.String tabTag,
                               java.lang.String tabName,
                               ContentPrototype content)
                        throws IllegalActionException,
                               NameDuplicationException
        Add a new content area to the MultiContent with a specific content. The new content area will be the last in order.
        Parameters:
        topLevel - The container containing all tab definitions. If the container does not have the attribute that contains all tab definition information, it will be created.
        tabTag - The tag identifier used for the content area.
        tabName - Name of the tab. Can be used for visualization.
        content - The specific content for the new tab.
        Returns:
        The tab identifier.
        Throws:
        NameDuplicationException - If the name coincides with an attribute already in the container.
        IllegalActionException - If the attribute is not of an acceptable class for the container, if the name contains a period, or if a content area with the same tag already exist.

      • addTab

        public java.lang.String addTab(ComponentEntity topLevel,
                               java.lang.String tabTag,
                               java.lang.String tabName)
                        throws IllegalActionException,
                               NameDuplicationException
        Add a new content area to the MultiContent. The new content area will be the last in order.
        Parameters:
        topLevel - The container containing all tab definitions. If the container does not have the attribute that contains all tab definition information, it will be created.
        tabTag - The tag identifier used for the content area.
        tabName - Name of the tab. Can be used for visualization.
        Returns:
        The tab identifier.
        Throws:
        NameDuplicationException - If the name coincides with an attribute already in the container.
        IllegalActionException - If the attribute is not of an acceptable class for the container, if the name contains a period, or if a content area with the same tag already exist.

      • addTab

        public java.lang.String addTab(ComponentEntity topLevel,
                               java.lang.String tabName,
                               ContentPrototype content)
                        throws NameDuplicationException,
                               IllegalActionException
        Add a new content area to the MultiContent. The new content area will be the last in order.
        Parameters:
        topLevel - The container containing all tab definitions. If the container does not have the attribute that contains all tab definition information, it will be created.
        tabName - Name of the tab. Can be used for visualization.
        content - The content to use in the new tab.
        Returns:
        The newly generated tab identifier.
        Throws:
        NameDuplicationException - If the name coincides with an attribute already in the container.
        IllegalActionException - If the tab could not be created in the model.

      • addTab

        public java.lang.String addTab(ComponentEntity topLevel,
                               java.lang.String tabName)
                        throws NameDuplicationException,
                               IllegalActionException
        Add a new content area to the MultiContent. The new content area will be the last in order.
        Parameters:
        topLevel - The container containing all tab definitions. If the container does not have the attribute that contains all tab definition information, it will be created.
        tabName - Name of the tab. Can be used for visualization.
        Returns:
        The newly generated tab identifier.
        Throws:
        NameDuplicationException - If the name coincides with an attribute already in the container.
        IllegalActionException - If the tab could not be created in the model.

      • addElement

        public void addElement(java.lang.String tabTag,
                       PositionableElement element)
                throws IllegalActionException
        Add an element to a specific content area.
        Parameters:
        tabTag - The tag identifying the content area.
        element - The element to be added to the content area.
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException - If the content area is not set.

      • removeElement

        public void removeElement(PositionableElement element)
        Remove an element from all content areas.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to be removed.

      • getContent

        public java.lang.Object getContent(java.lang.String tabTag)
        Get a content area based on a unique tag value.
        Parameters:
        tabTag - The tag that identifies a content area.
        Returns:
        The content area object.

      • getAllTabs

        public java.util.ArrayList<TabDefinition> getAllTabs()
        Get all content areas as a list. This list is ordered based in the ordering in the original model.
        Returns:
        The ordered list of content areas.

      • removeTab

        public void removeTab(java.lang.String tag)
        Remove a content area from the contents.
        Parameters:
        tag - The identifier of the tab to be removed.

      • setNameAt

        public void setNameAt(int position,
                      java.lang.String text)
               throws IllegalActionException
        Rename a content area at a given position.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the tab.
        text - The new title of the tab.
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException - If the new name is not accepted by the model.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear all data.

      • getElement

        public PositionableElement getElement(NamedObj object)
        Return a positionable element if the named object is in any of the tabs.
        Parameters:
        object - The named object to check.
        Returns:
        The positionable element wrapping the named object if it's contained, null otherwise.

      • _getContents

        protected java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,TabDefinition> _getContents()
        Return the content mapping.
        Returns:
        The mapping of tag identifiers to tab definitions.

      • _getOrder

        protected java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> _getOrder()
        Return the order of the contents.
        Returns:
        The ordered list of tag identifiers.

      • _initializeContents

        protected void _initializeContents(ContentPrototype contentPrototype,
                                   CompositeEntity model)
                            throws IllegalActionException,
                                   NameDuplicationException
        Parse the model and create the multiple content areas. All elements that have positions defined are placed into a content area defined by the elements parameters.
        Parameters:
        contentPrototype - A prototype of the content area. This prototype is used to create multiple content areas on demand.
        model - The model to be parsed.
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException - If any of the elements can't be places into a content area.
        NameDuplicationException - If multiple elements exist with the same name. Element names within a workspace must be unique.
